Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: ATAC-seq was performed as published (Corces et al. 2017 "An improved ATAC-seq protocol reduced background and enables interrogation of frozen tissues") without any modifications
ATAC-seq: ATAC-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie, with the parameters -X 2000 -m 1 -p 4. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools

Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: ATAC-seq was performed as published (Corces et al. 2017 "An improved ATAC-seq protocol reduced background and enables interrogation of frozen tissues") without any modifications
ATAC-seq: ATAC-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie, with the parameters -X 2000 -m 1 -p 4. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools

Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: ATAC-seq was performed as published (Corces et al. 2017 "An improved ATAC-seq protocol reduced background and enables interrogation of frozen tissues") without any modifications
ATAC-seq: ATAC-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie, with the parameters -X 2000 -m 1 -p 4. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools

Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were fixed in complete media with 1% formaldehyde for 10 minutes at room temperature or 0.3% formaldehyde for 30 minutes at 4ºC then quenched by addition of 0.125 M glycine for 5 minutes at room temperature and 15 minutes on ice. Fixed cells were then pelleted and washed once with 1x PBS before snap-freezing on dry-ice. Cell pellets were lysed in three successive buffers for 10 minutes each at 4ºC while rotating end-over-end (LB1: 50 mM HEPES-KOH pH 7.5, 120 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 10% glycerol, 0.5% NP-40, 0.25% Triton X-100, LB2: 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 200 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, LB3: 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 100 mM NaCl, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5 mM EGTA, 0.1% Na-Deoxycholate, 0.5% N-lauroylsarcosine). Lysates were then sonicated with a Branson450D cup-horn system to produce chromatin fragments between 100 and 600 bps. Triton X-100 was added to cell lysate and then centrifuged at 20,000 g for 15 minutes at 4ºC to pellet debris. Supernatant equivalent to 10 million cells brought to a final volume of 500 µL using LB3 was used for each immunoprecipitation. A quantity of sonicated chromatin was set aside as 10% input. 2 µg of Histone H3 acetyl K27 (abcam, ab4729) or Histone H3 tri-methyl K4 (abcam, ab8580) antibodies were added to the lysate for overnight incubation at 4ºC. Protein G Magnetic Dynabeads® (ThermoFisher Scientific) were used for pulldown. Immunoprecipitated chromatin bound to dynabeads was washed with four successive buffers (LSB: 20 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 150 mM NaCl, 0.1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA; MSB: 20 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 250 mM NaCl, 0.1% SDS, 1% Triton X-100, 2 mM EDTA; LiCl wash: 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 250 mM LiCl, 0.5% NP-40, 0.5% Na-deoxycholate, 1 mM EDTA; 1x TE: 10 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA). Chromatin was then eluted from dynabeads in 150 µL EB (50 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.0, 10 mM EDTA, 1% SDS) by incubating at 65ºC for 30 minutes. Immunoprecipitated samples and input were incubated overnight at 65ºC to denature formaldehyde crosslinking. Samples were then treated with RNaseA (ThermoFisher Scientific) followed by proteinase K (Sigma Aldrich) before phenol/chloroform extraction. DNA was precipitated using 5M NaCl, glycoblue (Ambion) and 100% absolute ethanol overnight at -80ºC. DNA was pelleted by centrifuging at 20,000 g for 30 minutes at 4ºC followed by a 70% ethanol wash. Final DNA pellet was resuspended in 50 uL of 1x TE buffer and placed in speedvac for 3 minutes. ChIP-seq libraries were generated using NEBNext Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs).
ChIP-seq: ChIP-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie2 with default paramters. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools

Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were fixed cells with PBS containing 0.3% formaldehyde for 30 mins rocking at 4 C and quenched by addition of 1/10 volume of 2M glycine with 5 min incubation at room temperature. Fixed cells were then washed once with 1x PBS and resuspended in 1 mL swelling buffer (25mM HEPES-NaOH pH7.5, 10mM KCl, 0.1% NP-40, 1.5mM MgCl2). After incubating 10 mins on ice, dounce homogenizer B was used to break cytoplasmic membrane, 20 strokes. 9mL of MNase digest buffer (15mM HEPES-NaOH pH7.9, 15mM NaCl, 60mM KCl, 0.32M sucrose) was added before spinning down at 2000 RPM for 7 mins at 4 C. Pellet(nuclei) was resuspended in 1 mL MNase digest buffer with 3.3 uL of 1 M CaCl2 and incubated for 15 mins at 37C. 0.5 uL of 2000 U/uL MNase per 107 cells was added for another 15 mins incubation for at 37C. Reaction was then quenched with 10uM EGTA before adding 1mL lysis buffer (20mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 200mM NaCl, 2mM EDTA, 1mM EGTA, 0.2% Na-Deoxycholate, 1% N-lauroylsarcosine) and 1% Triton X-100. Lysate was passed through 21G needle 5 times and spinned down at 13000 g at 4C for 15 minutes. 30ug of SMARCA4 antibody (abcam, ab110641) was added to supernatant with overnight end-over-end mixing at 4C. 50 uL of Protein-G Dynabeads (Invitrogene) per IP was added to lysate and incubated at 4C with rotation for at least 2 hours. Beads were washed 4 times with RIPA buffer for 5 minutes each and once with TE, 50 mM NaCl solution. Elution buffer with 100 uL of 100 mM NaHCO3/1% SDS (make fresh) was added to beads and incubated for 17 mins at 65C on Thermos mixer shaking at 1500 RPM. Supernatant was recovered into a new eppendorf tube followed by adding 5 uL of 5 M NaCl. Samples were decrosslinked overnight at 65C. After incubations with RNAseA (3ul, 10ug/mL) for 30 mins at 37C and Proteinase K (5uL, 10ug/mL) for 1 hour at 55C, DNA was cleaned with DNA clean and concentrate kit (Zymo Research). ChIP-seq libraries were generated using NEBNext Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs).
ChIP-seq: ChIP-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie2 with default paramters. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools

Sample_title: SMARCA4-infected H1703 Input for SMARCA4 ChIP-seq
Sample_extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were fixed cells with PBS containing 0.3% formaldehyde for 30 mins rocking at 4 C and quenched by addition of 1/10 volume of 2M glycine with 5 min incubation at room temperature. Fixed cells were then washed once with 1x PBS and resuspended in 1 mL swelling buffer (25mM HEPES-NaOH pH7.5, 10mM KCl, 0.1% NP-40, 1.5mM MgCl2). After incubating 10 mins on ice, dounce homogenizer B was used to break cytoplasmic membrane, 20 strokes. 9mL of MNase digest buffer (15mM HEPES-NaOH pH7.9, 15mM NaCl, 60mM KCl, 0.32M sucrose) was added before spinning down at 2000 RPM for 7 mins at 4 C. Pellet(nuclei) was resuspended in 1 mL MNase digest buffer with 3.3 uL of 1 M CaCl2 and incubated for 15 mins at 37C. 0.5 uL of 2000 U/uL MNase per 107 cells was added for another 15 mins incubation for at 37C. Reaction was then quenched with 10uM EGTA before adding 1mL lysis buffer (20mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 200mM NaCl, 2mM EDTA, 1mM EGTA, 0.2% Na-Deoxycholate, 1% N-lauroylsarcosine) and 1% Triton X-100. Lysate was passed through 21G needle 5 times and spinned down at 13000 g at 4C for 15 minutes. 30ug of SMARCA4 antibody (abcam, ab110641) was added to supernatant with overnight end-over-end mixing at 4C. 50 uL of Protein-G Dynabeads (Invitrogene) per IP was added to lysate and incubated at 4C with rotation for at least 2 hours. Beads were washed 4 times with RIPA buffer for 5 minutes each and once with TE, 50 mM NaCl solution. Elution buffer with 100 uL of 100 mM NaHCO3/1% SDS (make fresh) was added to beads and incubated for 17 mins at 65C on Thermos mixer shaking at 1500 RPM. Supernatant was recovered into a new eppendorf tube followed by adding 5 uL of 5 M NaCl. Samples were decrosslinked overnight at 65C. After incubations with RNAseA (3ul, 10ug/mL) for 30 mins at 37C and Proteinase K (5uL, 10ug/mL) for 1 hour at 55C, DNA was cleaned with DNA clean and concentrate kit (Zymo Research). ChIP-seq libraries were generated using NEBNext Ultra II DNA Library Prep Kit for Illumina (New England Biolabs).
sample_name: SMARCA4-infected H1703 Input for SMARCA4 ChIP-seq
ChIP-seq: ChIP-seq reads were mapped to the hg19 genome using bowtie2 with default paramters. Duplicate reads were removed using samtools. Bigwig files were generated using DeepTools
